title: The Story of Carl Gustav Jung. Part 2: 67,000 dreams
creator_credit: Jonathan Stedall and British Broadcasting Corporation
brief_description: Part two of a three part series on the work and life of Carl Gustav Jung, the pioneer of modern psychology. Explains the development of his major theories and concepts and examines his life from the age of forty onwards. Points out that Jung had psychoanalysed 67,000 dreams by this stage and had also written several works on psychoanalysis. Contains some b&w footage. Presented by Laurens Van der Post who knew the Jung from 1946 until his death in 1961.
